channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Brush Fire - Now Out; INC#1692; 07:31PM; SB 101 Fwy x San Bernardino Fwy; MAP: https://bit.ly/44opfBb; #BoyleHeights; Eighteen firefighters extinguished flames burning approximately one-half of an acre of light-to-medium brush, in 20 minutes. No structures damaged. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E17 E2 E209 E3; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1027; 02:51PM; 450 E 31st St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rrw9qE; #HistoricSouthCentral; A grass fire in a large lot quickly spread to a shed, and then into a one-story single-family home. Fire extended through the entire attic. It took 32 firefighters 49 minutes to extinguish all aspects of this fire. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E10 E14 E15 E210 E215 E46 EA1 RA14 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1027; 02:02PM; 3124 S Maple Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JYY33H; #HistoricSouthCentral; Vegetation fire in a vacant lot extended into the attic of a single-family home. Offensive mode.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E14 E15 E215 RA14 SQ21 T15; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0739; 11:52AM; 7317 W Hawthorn Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ob61cC; #Hollywood; The first 24 LAFD firefighters took 18 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames in a two-story L-shaped center hallway apartment building. No one required evacuation, but were encouraged to remain in their units with doors closed to escape the smoke ("shelter-in-place"). Firefighters kept the fire to the unit-of-origin. One patient (elderly female) was evaluated and transported with moderate smoke inhalation. Cause under investigation. ; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC1 BC14 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E108 E203 E220 E227 E229 E261 E29 E3 E41 E61 E68 EM14 HR3 RA61 RA68 RA803 T20 T27 T29 T3 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0739; 11:34AM; 7317 W Hawthorn Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ob61cC; #Hollywood; Fire in one unit of an L-shaped apartment building (center hallway). One patient being assessed by paramedics.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC1 BC14 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E108 E203 E220 E227 E229 E261 E29 E3 E41 E61 E68 EM14 HR3 RA61 RA68 RA803 T20 T27 T29 T3 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0540; 09:50AM; 9100 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NL3eW2; #GreenMeadows; The first 12 firefighters quickly deployed hose lines, with the primary objective of keeping the fire contained to the RV and sparing the church. Thankfully, their efforts were successful. Crews protected the nearby structure, and extinguished the flames consuming the RV. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 E261 E264 E64 RA264 T61 T64; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0540; 09:41AM; 9100 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NL3eW2; #GreenMeadows; Heavy fire showing from an RV, threatening a nearby church building. Offensive mode.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 E261 E264 E64 RA264 T61 T64; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0447; 09:07AM; 1783 E 45th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3XPYZgw; #CentralAlameda; The first 40 LAFD firefighters to arrive, along with LA County FD companies, extinguished the flames in 19 minutes. An outside fire extended in to a metal-clad building. Thankfully, fire sprinklers limited the ability for the fire to grow. Firefighters will remain on scene to mitigate water damage from the sprinklers and fire hose use, and restore the sprinkler system to be ready to protect the building for a future hazard. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation. ; FS 21; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E14 E17 E202 E203 E21 E210 E215 E221 E233 E3 E46 E9 EM13 HR3 RA14 RA21 RA803 SQ21 T10 T15 T2 T3 T33 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0447; 08:48AM; 4433 S Alameda St; MAP: https://bit.ly/43nJ5eC; #CentralAlameda; Large one-story metal-clad commercial building with smoke showing.; FS 21; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E14 E17 E21 E210 E233 RA14 RA21 SQ21 T10 T33 T9; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#1353; 07:03PM; 7764 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pCoi9m; #Hollywood; 126 LAFD Firefighters - joined by neighboring Los Angeles County Firefighters in Automatic Aid, engaged in a fierce 102 minute firefight (5:21 PM to 7:03 PM) to access, confine and extinguish this Major Emergency blaze. The fire was initially reported as a pair of vehicles burning in a apartment carport, which extended to involve two of three identical side-by-side apartment buildings, including the thirty-two unit, 18,900 square foot two-story centrally located apartment building of fire origin, where flames that had already extended to the large common attic on LAFD arrival, caused severe damage to that attic and sixteen apartment units on the second floor, including structural compromise and partial collapse. Flames from that building extended to stubbornly involve the attic of the identical adjoining apartment buildings to the *east*, which sustained severe attic damage. An additional three story apartment building *further east* at the southwest corner of Hollywood Boulevard and Genesee Avenue, sustained only smoke damage. The woman with mobility challenges who had been trapped by smoke and flames on the second floor of the apartment building of fire origin, was rescued by first arriving LAFD Firefighters. She was initially described as being in fair condition after sustaining smoke exposure, and is now being treated at an area hospital. One LAFD Firefighter sustained a hand laceration during fire attack. After being treated at scene, he returned to the firefight. No other injuries have been reported. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. MEDIA: LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Erik Scott is en route, ETA 8:15 PM.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CE83 CM20 CM22 CM52 E11 E203 E220 E226 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E278 E29 E3 E41 E61 E88 E97 EA1 EM11 EM14 EM9 HR3 PH1 RA41 RA52 RA76 RA803 RA82 RA97 SQ21 T20 T26 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 T78 UR3 UR88 + LACoFD BC1 E7 LF8; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey
